name: notification-parameters
description: Represents BACnet Notification Parameters, which encapsulate event and alarm notification data for various BACnet event types. This choice structure provides specialized parameter sets for different notification scenarios, enabling comprehensive event reporting across BACnet systems.

options.name: change-of-bitstring
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-bitstring event, triggered when a bit string value changes.

fields.name: referenced-bitstring
fields.description: The bit string value that triggered the notification.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

options.name: change-of-state
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-state event, triggered when an object transitions to a new state.

fields.name: new-state
fields.description: The new state value of the object.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

options.name: change-of-value
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-value event, triggered when a monitored value changes significantly.

fields.name: new-value

options.name: changed-bits
options.description: The bits that have changed in a bit string value.

options.name: changed-value
options.description: The new numeric value that triggered the notification.

fields.description: The new value, either as changed bits or a numeric value.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

options.name: command-failure
options.description: Notification parameters for a command-failure event, triggered when a command does not achieve the expected result.

fields.name: command-value
fields.description: The value of the command that was issued.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: feedback-value
fields.description: The actual feedback value received, indicating the command failure.

options.name: floating-limit
options.description: Notification parameters for a floating-limit event, triggered when a value deviates from a setpoint by more than a specified error limit.

fields.name: reference-value
fields.description: The current reference value being monitored.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: setpoint-value
fields.description: The setpoint value from which the reference value has deviated.

fields.name: error-limit
fields.description: The maximum allowed deviation from the setpoint value.

options.name: out-of-range
options.description: Notification parameters for an out-of-range event, triggered when a real value exceeds a defined limit.

fields.name: exceeding-value
fields.description: The value that exceeded the limit.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: deadband
fields.description: The deadband value used to prevent rapid toggling of the event state.

fields.name: exceeded-limit
fields.description: The limit value that was exceeded.

options.name: complex-event-type
options.description: Notification parameters for a complex event type, containing a series of property-value pairs for vendor-specific or advanced event scenarios.

options.name: change-of-life-safety
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-life-safety event, triggered when a life safety system changes state or mode.

fields.name: new-state
fields.description: The new life safety state.

fields.name: new-mode
fields.description: The new life safety mode.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: operation-expected
fields.description: The life safety operation expected to be performed.

options.name: extended
options.description: Notification parameters for vendor-specific extended events, allowing custom event types beyond the standard BACnet event definitions.

fields.name: vendor-id
fields.description: The vendor identifier for the vendor-specific event type.

fields.name: extended-event-type
fields.description: The vendor-specific event type identifier.

fields.name: parameters

options.name: null
options.description: No parameter value.

options.name: real
options.description: A real number parameter.

options.name: unsigned
options.description: An unsigned integer parameter.

options.name: boolean
options.description: A boolean parameter.

options.name: integer
options.description: A signed integer parameter.

options.name: double
options.description: A double-precision floating-point parameter.

options.name: octetstring
options.description: An octet string parameter.

options.name: characterstring
options.description: A character string parameter.

options.name: bitstring
options.description: A bit string parameter.

options.name: enumerated
options.description: An enumerated value parameter.

options.name: date
options.description: A date parameter.

options.name: time
options.description: A time parameter.

options.name: objectidentifier
options.description: A BACnet object identifier parameter.

options.name: property-value
options.description: A device object property value parameter.

fields.description: A series of parameters for the extended event, which can be of various data types.

options.name: buffer-ready
options.description: Notification parameters for a buffer-ready event, triggered when a data buffer reaches a threshold and is ready for retrieval.

fields.name: buffer-property
fields.description: Reference to the buffer property that is ready.

fields.name: previous-notification
fields.description: The record number of the previous buffer-ready notification.

fields.name: current-notification
fields.description: The record number of the current buffer-ready notification.

options.name: unsigned-range
options.description: Notification parameters for an unsigned-range event, triggered when an unsigned integer value exceeds a defined limit.

fields.name: exceeding-value
fields.description: The unsigned value that exceeded the limit.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: exceeded-limit
fields.description: The limit value that was exceeded.

options.name: access-event
options.description: Notification parameters for an access-event, triggered by physical access control events such as door access attempts.

fields.name: access-event
fields.description: The type of access event that occurred.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: access-event-tag
fields.description: A unique tag identifying this access event instance.

fields.name: access-event-time
fields.description: The timestamp when the access event occurred.

fields.name: access-credential
fields.description: Reference to the access credential used in the event.

fields.name: authentication-factor
fields.description: Optional authentication factor information associated with the access event.

options.name: double-out-of-range
options.description: Notification parameters for a double-out-of-range event, triggered when a double-precision value exceeds a defined limit.

fields.name: exceeding-value
fields.description: The double-precision value that exceeded the limit.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: deadband
fields.description: The deadband value used to prevent rapid toggling of the event state.

fields.name: exceeded-limit
fields.description: The limit value that was exceeded.

options.name: signed-out-of-range
options.description: Notification parameters for a signed-out-of-range event, triggered when a signed integer value exceeds a defined limit.

fields.name: exceeding-value
fields.description: The signed integer value that exceeded the limit.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: deadband
fields.description: The deadband value used to prevent rapid toggling of the event state.

fields.name: exceeded-limit
fields.description: The limit value that was exceeded.

options.name: unsigned-out-of-range
options.description: Notification parameters for an unsigned-out-of-range event, triggered when an unsigned integer value exceeds a defined limit.

fields.name: exceeding-value
fields.description: The unsigned integer value that exceeded the limit.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: deadband
fields.description: The deadband value used to prevent rapid toggling of the event state.

fields.name: exceeded-limit
fields.description: The limit value that was exceeded.

options.name: change-of-characterstring
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-characterstring event, triggered when a character string value changes to a specified alarm value.

fields.name: changed-value
fields.description: The new character string value that triggered the notification.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: alarm-value
fields.description: The alarm value that the changed value matched or triggered.

options.name: change-of-status-flags
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-status-flags event, triggered when object status flags change.

fields.name: present-value
fields.description: Optional present value of the object at the time the status flags changed.

fields.name: referenced-flags
fields.description: The status flags that have changed.

options.name: change-of-reliability
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-reliability event, triggered when an object's reliability status changes.

fields.name: reliability
fields.description: The new reliability value of the object.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: property-values
fields.description: A series of property values providing additional context about the reliability change.

options.name: change-of-discrete-value
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-discrete-value event, triggered when a discrete value changes to a new state.

fields.name: new-value

options.name: boolean
options.description: A boolean discrete value.

options.name: unsigned
options.description: An unsigned integer discrete value.

options.name: integer
options.description: A signed integer discrete value.

options.name: enumerated
options.description: An enumerated discrete value.

options.name: characterstring
options.description: A character string discrete value.

options.name: octetstring
options.description: An octet string discrete value.

options.name: date
options.description: A date discrete value.

options.name: time
options.description: A time discrete value.

options.name: objectidentifier
options.description: An object identifier discrete value.

options.name: datetime
options.description: A date-time discrete value.

fields.description: The new discrete value that triggered the notification.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

options.name: change-of-timer
options.description: Notification parameters for a change-of-timer event, triggered when a timer object transitions to a new state.

fields.name: new-state
fields.description: The new state of the timer.

fields.name: status-flags
fields.description: The status flags indicating the state of the object at the time of notification.

fields.name: update-time
fields.description: The date and time when the timer state was updated.

fields.name: last-state-change
fields.description: Optional information about the last state transition of the timer.

fields.name: initial-timeout
fields.description: Optional initial timeout value in seconds.

fields.name: expiration-time
fields.description: Optional date and time when the timer will expire.
